1
IndividualYour relationship with yourself
Your relationship with yourself. Daily practices, honesty, self-care. Before you can show up for anyone else, you have to show up for yourself. This means having non-negotiables â€” things you do for yourself every day, no matter what. It's not selfish. It's required. If this level isn't solid, everything above it is unstable.
2
FamilyYour closest relationships
Your immediate family â€” spouse, kids, or the family you live with. If you're estranged or don't have family, this is about your closest relationships. These are the people who see you at your best and worst. You can't skip to community impact if things are incomplete here.
3
GroupsTeams, friends, communities
Friends, coworkers, teams, extended family â€” people outside your immediate circle. If you're isolated, this level is about that too. The question: Are you being yourself, or performing a version of yourself to fit in â€” or hiding entirely?
4
CommunityYour role in the larger whole
Where you belong beyond personal relationships â€” neighborhood, industry, causes, or any group you're part of. Whether you're working, retired, or still figuring it out, the question is the same: do you have a role, and do you respect the roles of others?
5
SocietySystems, culture, nation
Your nation and its systems â€” government, economy, culture. This level is about seeing reality clearly. Not what you wish was true. Not what you're fighting against. What actually is. You can't change what you won't first accept.
6
WorldGlobal connection
Beyond your immediate world â€” other nations, other cultures, humanity as a whole. How connected do you feel to what happens outside your borders? This isn't about being an activist. It's about recognizing you're part of something larger than your own life.
7
GenerationsLegacy that outlasts you
What you're building that will outlast you â€” whether that's family, work, impact, or simply how you live. This isn't about fame or wealth. It's about sustainability. Will what you create survive without you? Legacy isn't always a building. Sometimes it's a cycle you refused to repeat.

Help & FAQ
What is the 7 Levels framework?
The 7 Levels of Self maps human growth across 7 dimensions: Individual (self), Family (close relationships), Groups (teams/friends), Community (local impact), Society (systems/culture), World (global connection), and Generations (legacy). You can't skip levels - each must be mastered before climbing higher.

3,000+ scenarios across all 7 levels, each designed to surface the patterns quietly running your life.
What wounds and themes does this address?
This game was built to help heal real human pain.

What's the difference between the 3 games?
ðŸªž Mirror Game: Self-reflection. See patterns honestly. No right/wrong - just recognition.

âš–ï¸ Agreement Game: Train yourself to choose acceptance over judgment. Timed to build instinct.

ðŸŒ Worldwide Challenge: Same 3 scenarios for everyone globally. One chance daily. Builds streak.
How do XP, levels, streaks & bonuses work?
XP & Leveling: Every answer earns XP. 500 XP = 1 level. Levels unlock new game modes and framework levels.

Unlocks: Level 2 â†’ Agreement Game + Family, Level 3 â†’ Groups, Level 5 â†’ Community, Level 7 â†’ Society, Level 10 â†’ World, Level 15 â†’ Generations

Coins: Earn coins (50% of XP) and tap them to open the Reward Shop. Redeem coins for workshop discounts, or save up for a FREE 1-on-1 session with Arthur!

Streaks: Complete the Worldwide Challenge daily. Miss a day and it resets!

Combos: Multiple correct answers in a row = bonus XP (5x = +15 XP, 10x = +40 XP).

Daily Login: Claim increasing XP rewards each day (up to 100 XP on day 7).
What does "Acceptance â‰  Agreement" mean?
This is the core philosophy. Acceptance means acknowledging reality as it is. Agreement means endorsing it.

You can accept that something IS without agreeing it SHOULD BE. Acceptance is the first step to change - you can't transform what you won't acknowledge.
